item.title: Natalie add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You love me. Real or not real?" I tell him, "Real." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You're still trying to protect me. Real or not real," he whispers. "Real," I answer. "Because that's what you and I do, protect each other." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "What I need is the dandelion in the spring. The bright yellow that means rebirth instead of destruction. The promise that life can go on, no matter how bad our losses. That it can be good again." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You here to finish me off, Sweetheart?" -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You're a painter. You're a baker. You like to sleep with the windows open. You never take sugar in your tea. And you always double-knot your shoelaces." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "I clench his hands to the point of pain. "Stay with me." His pupils contract to pinpoints, dialate again rapidly, and then return to something resembling normalcy. "Always," he murmurs." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Suzanne Collins
Natalie add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Sometimes when I'm alone, I take the pearl from where it lives in my pocket and try to remember the boy with the bread, the strong arms that warded off nightmares on the train, the kisses in the arena." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description:
"So I only say, "So what should we do with our last few days?"
"I just want to spend every possible minute of the rest of my life with you," Peeta replies." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description:
"Peeta, how come I never know when you're having a nightmare?” I say.
“I don't know. I don't think I cry out or thrash around or anything. I just come to, paralyzed with terror,” he says.
“You should wake me,” I say, thinking about how I can interrupt his sleep two or three times on a bad night. About how long it can take to calm me down.
“It's not necessary. My nightmares are usually about losing you,” he says. “I'm okay once I realize you're here." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "There's a chance that the old Peeta, the one who loves you, is still inside. Trying to get back to you. Don't give up on him." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Suzanne Collins
